sanskrit_verse:
आतुरामभिशस्तां वा चौरव्याघ्रादिभिर्भयैः ।
पतितां पङ्कलग्नां वा सर्वौपायैर्विमोचयेत् ॥ ११.११२॥
सर्वप्राणैर्विमोचयेत्
transliteration: āturām abhiśastāṁ vā cauravyāghrādibhir bhayaiḥ | patitāṁ paṅkalagnāṁ vā sarvopāyair vimocayet || 11.112 || sarvaprāṇair vimocayet
sph_interpretive_translation: One must liberate by all means—whether the being is diseased, accused, endangered by tigers and bandits, fallen or stuck in mud—or even at the cost of one's own life.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises from capacity to act for the liberation of another
Causation is traced through conscious intervention, not passive observation
Capacity-based responsibility extends beyond species and social status
Restoration logic demands immediate action regardless of personal risk
Consciousness alignment occurs when self-interest dissolves into service
executable_legal_axioms: IF a sentient being is in danger THEN deploy maximum available resources for rescue
IF a person is accused OR physically imperiled THEN assume duty of protection OVER personal safety
IF capacity to act exists AND delay increases harm THEN immediate intervention is mandatory
IF rescue requires sacrifice of personal assets OR life THEN compliance remains unconditional
IF no direct causal link is visible THEN default to preservation of consciousness-integrity
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Adjudication, this verse establishes that the highest threshold of dharma-duty supersedes institutional boundaries and personal preservation. Where evidence of peril exists—even indirect—the court must activate protocols ensuring total extraction from threat, overriding procedural inertia or hierarchical limitations.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that suffering arises from unaddressed entanglement; therefore, causality lies in failure to act, not in the act itself. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows sequential descent into degradation unless interrupted by conscious agency. Thus, proportional responsibility demands full effort toward liberation without punitive attribution. The non-punitive reality rule confirms that justice manifests only where integration resumes.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate emergency completion process upon detection of any form of entrapment
Assign guardianship until full restoration of mobility and autonomy
Deploy multidimensional support systems including physical, emotional, and spiritual aid
Reintegrate subject into community with honor and acknowledgment of their inherent divinity
Ensure perpetrator or system causing entrapment undergoes integrity realignment, not punishment
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: Dharma prevails through active liberation. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the sole adjudicator. All beings are restored.
